Posts.Content: momtomy5 wrote: what does this mean/stand for?  I had a lumpectomy, but see this written on a report post surgery saying my mammo was abnormal and I need to see my dr....post surgery...where everything was 'radial scar, benign'....but what is this meaning?  DO I need more procedures?  what is the bi sentinel node thing?  I have nothing saying they looked at nodes.  am I confused at the meaning of this. Posts.Title: bi sentinal node needle loc.??? i'm confused. momtomy5 djmammo

Posts.Content: Aug 4, 2018 09:36PM momtomy5 wrote: Normal breast tissue I assume.  I don't really know, I guess.   So is there still a chance this will come back as cancer?
Posts.Title: biopsy benign, dr still wants to do more momtomy5 fishfish

Posts.Content: momtomy5 wrote: I had a CT scan a few weeks ago for a kidney stone.  the CT showed a nodule on my breast that started this whole party.  Mammogram.  more mammogram.  hand held ultrasound.  callback for ABUS ultrasound.  THe concern at this point is NOT the nodule but another spot they found.  An 'architectural distortion with spiculations.'   Then I got a call for a biopsy.  Stereotactic biopsy.  The dr said 'I am not going to lie to you.  what I see is very concerning.  But we've found it early and we will deal with it.'   Once biopsy results came back, benign, he called and said 'I just don't feel good about leaving this in your breast even though the biopsy says benign.  I told you I was concerned about it, and I still am.'   So I don't know how or why.  why is it negative and he still wants to do a lumpectomy and send it to pathology?  I thought we would be done with the biopsy.   What they see is not a tumor or nodule.  did he maybe biopsy an area not showing cancer?  I just have a lot of questions and am confused.  I meet with him on Monday to discuss a lumpectomy. Posts.Title: biopsy benign, dr still wants to do more momtomy5 fishfish

Posts.Content: Aug 4, 2018 11:39PM momtomy5 wrote: I've had CT's before for kidnsey stones and I can't remembwr them going that high. However if it caused them to find something bad then it's a good thing it happened the way it did! I'm going with his recommendations. My concern is that something is hiding in dense tissue. And better now than later if it is something malignant. Thank you for your information.  On a flip note my husband insists that because the biopsy was benign that this test will also show nothing. I’m not as convinced.
